item.title: Christmas trees left on pavement, 15th January
item.description:
There are two Christmas trees which have been left on the pavement outside 120 Albion Drive and 126 Albion Drive for over 2 weeks. I can only assume that the residents in the 2 properties do not have a garden waste subscription.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Albion Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed limit sign has been pushed over, 15th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Goldfinch Road, Thamesmead

item.title: Overrun wth foxes, 15th January
item.description:
We have constant issues with foxes. We have to clear up faeces in the garden every day, they dig up the garden, destroy things & take things from our gardens and constantly urinate by my back door so that the whole house stinks. They keep us awake at night
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shepherdess Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are a number of potholes, 15th January
item.description:
These are getting bigger especially on days when we have rain showers
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Prospect Vale, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Peabody lights aren't working, 15th January
item.description:
Peabody keeps closing reports on the non -functioning street lights on Thames Reach because they don't understand that Peabody owns ALL OF Thamesmead (ask your manager if you don't believe me). Thames Reach is a private road, owned by Peabody, so Greenwich won't touch it. I am a Peabody resident and live on this road, so I know what I'm talking about. Please, PLEASE, don't close this ticket; pass it to your estates team, because even the Fix My Street app knows this area is Peabody's responsibility (see attached images).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thames Reach, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stones, mud and mess along the road, 15th January
item.description:
Lorries have come from the development in Little Birches filled with earth and stones and obviously over filled the truck which has then driven up Harland Avenue and dropped stones and mud all the road. It looks dreadful, it is damaging our vehicles and made them filthy. I live on Harland Avenue so cannot avoid. And to top this off the road has been damaged and the number of potholes in the road is disgusting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Harland Avenue, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black Audi YR67YMX has not moved for many weeks, causing obstruction., 15th January
item.description:
This black Audi appears to be abandoned, and is too close to the roundabout for safety. An accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 194, Poverest Road, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Elm Drive street sign for footpath been knocked over and not replaced, 15th January
item.description:
Elm Drive street sign for footpath been knocked over and not replaced. This is for properties 1 - 19 down a footpath. Used to be a street sign, knocked over when council cut grass and never replaced.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Shurlock Avenue, White Oak, Swanley
